event.title: lies on the Paraná Delta and is an important tourist and weekend

data.event: Tigre lies on the Paraná Delta and is an important tourist and weekend attraction, easily reached by bus and train services, including the scenic Tren de la Costa.
The town sits on an island created by several small streams and rivers and was founded in 1820, after floods had destroyed other settlements in the area, then known as the Partido de las Conchas.

event.title: were hunted there, on occasions, in its early years

data.event: The area's name derives from the “tigres” or jaguars that were hunted there, on occasions, in its early years.
The “Puerto de Frutos” (fruit port) is now a crafts fair located in the old fruit market by the riverside.
